lexUnit.name: boil.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cook by immersing in boiling water

sentence.text: Poach , boil or scramble the eggs , or make into an omelette in a non-stick pan with a minimum of low-fat margarine .
Boil eggs and decorate them with paints and put tufts of wool on for hair .
Dinner I boil myself just a few potatoes , and I eat them with a piece of bread
Boil the potatoes until well done and mash with a little water to achieve a soft consistency .
You can boil meat , potatoes , pasta or rice , make a stew or soup in the base pan , steam your vegetables in the steamer and simmer your gravy or sauce in the porringer on top .
Then steam or boil the vegetables in a small amount of salted water , before draining and tossing them in melted butter .
Boil all the vegetables together in a large saucepan until tender .
1 Boil the rice for 3 minutes in water , then drain .
They boil them in an iron saucepan .
Boil the pasta in plenty of boiling salted water .
Do they still boil cabbage to a soupy pulp in Britain , and pour the vitamin C down the drain ?
By 10am , the potatoes have been boiled and roasted and stored in insulated containers .
Add the beans to a large saucepan of boiling water and boil rapidly for 10min .
The hallway smelt of boiled cabbage and old rag mats .
Our Royal menu consisted of : breakfast , one pot of wish-wash called ` tea " ; lunch , a pot of dry vegetables boiled in water , one pot of vermicelli boiled in water .
